Based on the data, which of the following most likely describes the evolutionary relationship among the organisms?

choices.label: Because brown algae, red algae, and cyanobacteria lack chlorophyll b, they evolved before green algae and flowering plants did.
Because green algae and flowering plants contain chloroplasts, they evolved more recently than brown algae, red algae, and cyanobacteria did.
Because increasingly complex forms of chlorophyll are found in red algae, brown algae, green algae, and flowering plants, respectively, this reflects the order of their appearance.
Because all of the organisms contain chlorophyll a, the organisms share a common ancestor.

content.answer: Because all of the organisms contain chlorophyll a, the organisms share a common ancestor.
